Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> We can only pick the exchanges that are available to us. This is the biggest decentralised exchange as I understand it. Also, I believe the more is better principle, as long as it is at a reasonable price. Getting on two big exchanges reasonably quickly will be a huge benefit to us.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <boxalex> Not always more is better, it should be a good reputation exchange as well. For example i personally would avoid at all costs exchanges like mercatox, livecoin, yobit und fake volume exchanges like Lbank and similars. But than again, that's just me. ....

I also think, getting listed on CMC would be really helpful, because it's kind of the standard  dictionary and who-is-who in things of cryptos.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <boxalex> trade ogre isn't a big volume exchange, but it is a reliable excahnge for the user as well. Payouts and Deposits are done very quick there, volume is real, no KYC, and one of the most easy to use exchanges, especially for newbies. As a starter exchange i really recommend it and i'am unbiased here. Writing this as someone have accounts on about 60 exchanges.....

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <boxalex> One more thing i would like to share for future listings, especially at the beginning. When i go through coinmarketcap sites and investigate a given coin and see exchanges like livecoin, yobit, mercatox as their main exchanges i just move ahead. These exchanges are mass involved in dump/pump shemes and scams. Just a point to think about that not ALWAYS more is better.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Patrick ManBearPig> @basti  *IF* funds are to be spent on getting listed, then in my opinion they would be better served being saved up to a point where a brand name exchange can be obtained. Every project needs to start somewhere, so I think people will accept being listed on a handful of lesser known/sketchy exchanges. As @boxalex mentioned though, at some point I think it starts acting against a projects reputation if someone goes on CMC and it is carried on too many of these less reputable exchanges. 

I have pointed out previously that gate.io does not charge for listings. I am sure there are a number of others. That said-- At this point, I would think the next move or two would be aiming to be listed on an upper-level exchange. 

Eventually, DP or AAcoin will likely be listed on CMC as well. Stex already is. So that would seem to meet the CMC requirement once they are.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick ManBearPig> That said, I have not and am not able to donate to the fund so take my opinion for what it's worth

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> I'm taking the position I've been taking, for two reasons. One, CMC is like what the Phone Book or the Yellow Pages used to be, for a person or a business. It gives a sense of legitimacy, for people that want that type of reasurrance.
And two, I'm not sure how long it will be before the Verus Vision is completed, or the base is finished. Because Mike & the dev team, are very very good and they do work fast. So wouldn't it be better to address some of these basic things now, rather than later?
